Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class represents the players in the game. The game iterates through the players and calls the turn() function of each.
    Author:
    Graham Netherton

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the AI's personal name. Used for identifying what code each AI is running.
        Returns:
        The AI's personal name as a string.

      • attack

        public java.lang.String attack(Node from,
                      Node to,
                      int num)
        Attacks an unowned node using units from an owned one. Returns a string containing the error if something went wrong, or null if nothing did. Call this any number of times from turn().
        Parameters:
        from - The node the attack is originating from.
        to - The node the attack is being made towards.
        num - The number of units being used to attack.
        Returns:
        A string containing the error message, or null if no error.

      • fortify

        public java.lang.String fortify(Node from,
                       Node to,
                       int num)
        Fortifies one node using units from another. Returns a string containing the error if something went wrong, or null if nothing did. Call this function once at the end of turn().
        Parameters:
        from - Node to transfer from.
        to - Node to transfer to.
        num - Number of units to transfer.
        Returns:
        A string containing the error message, or null if no error.
